questions.text: A patient presented with few areas of hypopigmented patches on the body and a history of seizure. ON undergoing a CT scan the following image is obtained. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
The given image shows subependymal calcification appears as candle drippling

  • The hypopigmented patches on the body know as - Ash leaf macules
  • In tuberous-sclerosis we have EPILOIA - Vogt's triad
  • In TS we can see foramen of monro - SEGA (subependymal giant cell astrocytoma)

Other findings in tubular-sclerosis:

  1. Cortical tubules
  2. Subependymal calcification
  3. SEGA
  4. Radial bands

questions.text: A patient presented with giddiness and difficulty in standing up. He underwent an MRI examination. On further evaluation he has a history of a family member suffering from the similar condition. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
In the given MRI image there is CP angle and there is bilateral icecream cone appearance in cerebellopontine angle

  • B/L vestibular schwannomas is a feature of NF2
  • NF2 are MISME lesions (Multiple Inherited Schwannoma Meningioma Ependymoma)

questions.text: A Child presented with a birthmark on the face and developmental delays. A Lateral skull radiograph obtained is shown . What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
In lateral skull radiograph shows

  • Tram track Calicification both are signs
  • Birth mark on the face know as por-twine stain of sturge-weber Syndrome
  • Sturge weber syndrome is also know as trigemino encephalic vascular malformation
    1. port-wine stain
    2. glaucoma
    3. lepto-meningeal vascular malformation
    4. hemiatrophy of brain ipsilateral to port-wine stain and seizures contralateral to port-wine stain

questions.text: A patient presented with CNS hemangioblastomas, renal angiomyolipoma and increased hematocrit levels. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
If there is >1 hemangioblastoma it is a Von hippel Lindau syndrome-chromosome 3 defect In VHL syndrome we can see

  • Retinal hemangioblastoma
  • Cerebellar hemangioblastoma
  • B/L clear cell RCC
  • Pancreatic cyst
  • Pheochromocytoma
  • Endolymphatic sac tumor

questions.text: A 30 year old female patient presented with headache and vertigo for the last 6 months. she was advised to undergo an MRI examination which is shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
These lesions more common in females than males due to hormone-Progesterone receptor

  • The image showing broad base towards Dura
  • And adject dura thickening know as Dural tail sign
  • Spoke wheel vasculature is present
  • Lesion showing early enhancement and delay washout - Mother in law sign

These all are features of Meningioma

  • Multiple Meningioma is also a feature of NF2

questions.text: A 40 year old female patient presented with ataxia and muscle weakness. she underwent MRI examination which is shown below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
In the MRI showing

Dawson fingers - Periventricular White Matter hyperintensities involving callososeptal interface seen in option

  1. Multiple sclerosis
  2. ADME - associated with H/O vaccinations and viral infections
  3. ALS - B/L corticospinal tract involvement

questions.text: An HIV positive patient presented with altered sensorium and fever. He underwent an MRI and following image is obtained. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
MRI of given image showing - Ring enhancing lesions at basal ganglion

  • Eccentric target sign in HIV and AIDS patients is due to toxoplasmosis

questions.text: What is being marked in the image below?
questions.solution: The structure in which basilar artery is present is identified as Pons

questions.text: What is the likely diagnosis of the case in below image
questions.solution:
This is an image of MRCP showing:

  • Pancreatic duct
  • CBD duct - with in the duct there are CBD stones
    1. Choledocholithiasis
    2. if there is narrowing of CBD - CBD stricture
  • If the CBD having linear filling defect - Biliary ascariasis
  • Double duct sign is seen in periampullary carcinoma

questions.text: A 35 year old male patient with mild fever and right upper quadrant pain and bloody diarhhea for past 7 days. On ultrasound there is a hypoechoic lesion with irregular borders in the posterosuperior aspect of right lobe of liver. What is the likely
A middle aged patient with lumbar pain, pyuria and fatigue. Plain Xray Abdomen is shown below. likely diagnosis is?
questions.solution:
Calcifications in the radiograph resemble renal pyramids, these are medullary nephron calcinosis- which occur in pts with – medullary sponge kidney, hyperparathyroidism. Medullary nephron calcinosis resembles renal pyramid

The symptoms such as lumbar pain, pyuria and fatigue are suggestive of parathyroid adenoma

In cortical nephron calcinosis occurs in alports syndrome,

Staghorn calculi resembles renal pelvis

questions.text: A 9yr old girl has brown skin rashes on chest, multiple bone lesions and fractures which show increased uptake on bone scan and endocrine thyroid abnormalities, what is likely diagnosis
questions.solution:
The radiograph shows ground glass opacities, shepherd crook deformity

Brown rashes seen are café-au-lait spots

Multiple bone lesions seen are polycystic fibrous dysplasia

The 9 year old is suggestive of precocious puberty

The increased uptake on bone scan is due to hot uptake

Café au lait spots are usually seen in nfi and mc-cune albright syndrome

questions.text: A 65 year old lady with backache and a lateral radiograph of the spine is shown, most likely diagnosis is?
questions.solution:
Spondylolisthesis has a beheaded Scottish dog appearance

Spondylolysis has a Scottish dog collar sign

Scottish dog appearance is normal

questions.text: A patient comes to emergency department with severe abdominal pain and an erect radiograph is shown, what is the definitive treatment of the given condition?
questions.solution:
The radiograph shows air under right hemidiaphragm which indicates hollow viscous perforation/pneumoperitoneum.

The definitive treatment is iv fluids and laparotomy

questions.text: A case of Allergic Rhinitis, NCCT image of Paranasal air sinuses shows an appearance known as?
questions.solution:
In allergic fungal sinusitis double density sign is seen, mucosal thickening will be less hyperdense.

The allergic response shows Charcot Leyden crystals which are more hyperdense.

questions.text: A known case of Pancreatitis develops Breathlessness, basal crepitations on day 4, CXR is shown, probable diagnosis is?
questions.solution:
The chest x-ray is showing white out lung, lung vol is also decreased

In ARDS on CT scan on comparison of anterior and posterior part, the posterior part has more pathology and this is called anteroposterior gradient

This is also suggestive of ARDS.

questions.text: An 65 yr old hypertensive pt on irregular medication has headache and a BP-220/110, CT head is shown below
questions.solution:
The ct shows a hyperdense area suggestive of a putaminal bleed of hemorrhagic stroke.

mc site of hypertensive bleed is putamen due to rupture of small aneurysms (charcot bouchard aneurysms).

choices.text: Below and medial to Trigone of bladder
Above the dome of the bladder

questions.text: Pt with History of Recurrent UTI, the IVP image is given, Identify the location of insertion of ureter arising from left superior pelvis?
questions.solution: The ivp image on the left side shows duplication. This duplication system follows a Weigert- Meyer rule- this rule says that ‘superior ureter inserts inferomedially (ectopically) and is prone to obstruction (ureterocoele)’

questions.text: A patient met with a RTA, is unconscious and the ct scan scan does not show any findings except for few petechial hemorrhages, what is the probable diagnosis
questions.solution: Whenever we have a normal CT scan after RTA think of diffuse axonal injury. In diffuse axonal injury-> MRI is the investigation of choice.

questions.text: A 35 year-old presented with fever and altered sensorium. CT scan reveals temporal hemorrhages. What is the likely Diagnosis?
questions.solution:
The most common lobe affected in HSV is temporal lobe

In Tb-> basal exudates, infarcts, hydrocephalus; this is the triad of tb meningitis

In JE-> bilateral thalami are involved

In varicella-> cerebellar hemisphere is involved

questions.text: A 60-year-old hypertensive patient presented with acute onset chest pain radiating to the neck and interscapular region. His blood pressure in right arm is 100/60 and in left arm is 170/90. Chest Xray shows mediastinal widening. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
In acute aortic dissection mainly involves ascending aorta this is called a Stanford A

IOC -> CT angiography if patient is stable, in case of unstable patient tee is the IOC.

questions.text: A 28 year old female on treatment for infertility develops severe abdominal pain, nausea and vomiting. USG reveals following appearance. What is the most likely cause?
questions.solution:
This is suggestive of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome since there is treatment of infertility (inj. HCG) and there is bilateral enlarged ovaries with large cysts associated with effusions ( 3rd space collections). There is more hemoconcentration- thrombosis.

In case of endogenous HCG (multiple pregnancy/ molar pregnancy) à theca lutein cysts

In PCOS small follicles which are less than 10 mm in size, more than 20 in number and large central stroma

questions.text: A Patient with prostrate cancer receives sequential radiotherapy at a dose of 1.8-2.4 Gy for 5 days every week, for 5-7 weeks this is called as?
questions.solution:
In regular fractioned rt -> 5 fractions/ week

In hypo-fractionated rt-> <5 fractions/week

In hyper-fractioned rt-> >5 fractions/week

In accelerated -> in non small cell lung cancer

And in continuous all 7 days are done

questions.text: A 2 year old child with sudden onset of breathlessness, Wheezing and Decreased breath sounds in rt lung, Chest Radiograph shows diffuse opacity in rt hemithorax, what is probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
On chest x ray if there is lucent hemithorax or opaque hemithorax then it is foreign body.

In lucent hemithorax there is air trapping in expiratory flip

In opaque hemithorax there is complete obstruction.

questions.text: A Patient with tingling, numbness and paresthesias in his lower extremities, suggestive of nerve root compression From the given radiological image disc between which vertebral levels is likely to be herniated.
questions.solution: Look at the vertebral levels, between l4 and l5 there is herniation. Identify the vertebral levels properly.

questions.text: 25 year old young male presenting with abdominal pain after sustaining blunt trauma to his abdomen during a road traffic accident, has a bp-120/80 and a pulse of 72 bpm. The next best step in management of this patient is?
questions.solution: Whenever there is a case of blunt trauma the first thing to do is Ultrasound (sonography).

questions.text: A 20 year old female presents with recurrent UTI. Identify the condition based on given ivp image?
questions.solution: Look at ivp image, there are 2 pelvic calyces on the right side and nothing seen on the left side. When you don't have the normal kidney on the normal side and the kidney has crossed the midline and fused with the other kidney it is called as crossed fused ectopic.

choices.text: Straightening of the left heart border

questions.text: Radiographic signs of left atrial enlargement are ?
questions.solution:
Signs of left atrial enlargement (mitral stenosis):

  • Enlargement of left atrial appendage
  • Straightening of left heart border
  • Elevation of left main bronchus
  • Splaying of carina
  • Walking man sign on lateral chest x-ray
  • Double density / double Rt heart border
  • 3rd mogul on chest x-ray
  • Anterior indentation of esophagus on barium swallow.

questions.text: A 35-year-old lady comes to the gynaecology OPD with chief complaints of primary infertility. She also suffers from vague pelvic pain for past few months . On further workup, HSG was performed and shown below. What's the correct diagnosis?
questions.solution: As you can see the image, there is no free spill of contrast in the image instead there is osteal blockade crossing at gross bilateral fallopian tubes indicating bilateral hydrosalpinx

questions.text: A 55-year-old chronic alcoholic male presented to the medicine OPD with chief complaints of chronic abdominal pain. He is hypertensive and a known diabetic on medications, The plain radiograph of the same patient is shown below. What is the correct diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Calcification in the pancreas are suggestive of chronic pancreatitis

Radiological findings suggestive are-

  • Tortuous/ beaded/ corkscrew pancreatic duct
  • Chain of lake appearance
  • Distal common bile duct strictures
  • Reverse 3 sign of frostberg on barium- chronic pancreatitis and Carcinoma head of pancreas

questions.text: Which of the following findings is not seen in renal tuberculosis?
questions.solution:
renal tuberculosis is spread by hematogenous spread and effects kidney

The earliest signs are

  • moth eaten calyces
  • Phantom calyx
  • Putty kidney
  • Cement kidney

Ureter findings à kinking

  • àTortuous / corkscrew/ beaded ureter

àon cystoscopy - golf hole ureteric orifice

Bladder findings

  • low volume
  • Atrophic
  • Non calcific bladder
  • Thimble bladder

Pear shaped bladder is not seen it usually means extrinsic compression.

questions.text: A 25 year old male with rt loin pain, vomitings presents to the emergency room, Xray KUB demonstrates a radioopaque stone in the rt kidney and ultrasound shows Right hydronephrosis, Which of the imaging modality can be used to characterise renal stone?
questions.solution:
To characterize the chemical composition DECT is used.

There are usually two kinds of energy in DECT - low kvp and high kvp

By using these 2 sources each element is seen at one particular energy.

So by using DECT we can know what type of element we are dealing with.

choices.text: Widening of C loop of duodenum

questions.text: Which of the following signs will not be seen in the carcinoma head of the pancreas?
questions.solution:
double duct sign - dilated common bile duct and dilated pd -> seen in periampullary ca and Ca head of pancreas

Both widening of c loop of duodenum and reverse 3 sign of frostburg are seen in chronic pancreatitis and ca head of pancreas

Colon cut off sign is a a feature of Acute pancreatitis and not seen in Ca head of pancreas

Radiological signs of Ca head of pancreas -

  • Antral pad sign
  • Widening of C shape loop of duodenum
  • Double duct sign
  • Mucosal irregularity/ rose thorning of medial wall of 2nd part of duodenum

choices.text: "Light bulb appearance on T2 images" is seen in hemangioma.
Hemangioma is the most common benign liver tumour in adults.
There is a proven association of hemangioma with the use of OCP in females.
There is a risk of hemoperitoneum with large hemangioma.

questions.text: A 33-year-old female underwent routine abdominal sonography and the sonologist noticed a focal lesion in segment V of the liver and she was advised multiphase MRI for characterisation of the lesion. The radiologist described the lesions as a "light bulb appearance on T2 images". Which of the following is not true about the described lesion?
questions.solution:
there is a proven association of hepatic adenoma with the use of ocp in females

Hemangioma show delayed enhancement, after initial peripheral nodular enhancement on delayed imaging then it shows delayed enhancement.

questions.text: Central stellate scar on imaging is seen in all the following except ?
questions.solution:
liver lesion with central stellate scar can be either focal nodular hyperplasia or focal lesion of hepatocellular carcinoma. Fnh shows hot uptake on sulfur colloid whereas fl-hcc shows low t2 ca+2.

A lesion in the kidney which has a central stellate scar is oncocytoma.

A lesion in the pancreas which has a central stellate scar is serous cystadenoma of pancreas

Central stellate scar is not seen in hepatic hemangioma.

choices.text: The condition is known as porcelain gallbladder.
There is a strong association between gall bladder carcinoma and porcelain GB.

questions.text: A 50-year-old male underwent contrast- enhanced CT abdomen. The radiologist noticed a incidental finding in the gallbladder fossa which is shown below. Which of the following is true about the given condition?
questions.solution: the image shows calcification of gall bladder, the given condition is a porcelain gallbladder which is premalignant. Since it is premalignant prophylactic cholecystectomy should be done, it has a strong association between gall bladder and porcelain GB. All of the statements are true.

questions.text: On a plain radiograph abdomen in a suspected case of bowel obstruction, small bowel can be differentiated from large bowel loops by having?
questions.solution:
differentiation of small bowel and large bowel obstruction

Small bowel obstruction;


Haustrations and peripherally placed loop bowels are seen in LBO

questions.text: Pulled up cecum sign is seen in which of the following condition?
questions.solution:
Normally ileo-caecal junction it is 90 degrees

In case of intestinal tb there is

  • Widening of ileo-caecal angle
  • Fleischner sing / inverted umbrella sign
  • Stierlin sign
  • Pulled up caecum
  • Goose neck deformity

questions.text: A 60 years old male presented to the emergency department with abdomen distension, vomiting and constipation. A plain radiograph of the abdomen was taken and shown below. What's the correct diagnosis?
questions.solution: the radiograph is showing classic coffee bean appearance which is suggestive of sigmoid volvulus.

choices.text: In doppler imaging, red always means arterial flow.
In doppler imaging, red means high resistance flow
In doppler imaging, red means flow away from the probe
Blue means the flow is away from the probe.

questions.text: Which of the following statement is true about the imaging shown below?
questions.solution: in doppler imaging, red means toward the probe and blue means away from the probe

questions.text: Which of the following imaging planes will be best to evaluate the hippocampus in a patient with suspected mesial temporal sclerosis?
questions.solution: To evaluate hippocampus we usually go to coronal oblique mri and we use hippocampus volumetry. If we have a case of dementia think of alzheimer's and if we have a case of epilepsy think of mesial temporal sclerosis

questions.text: Which of the following has a low signal on T1 w images?
questions.solution:
Fluid will be dark on T1 and water will be white on T2.

Structures hyperintense on T1-

  • Fat
  • Meth hb- subacute hb
  • Minerals like copper
  • Melanin
  • Protein content can be seen in posterior pituitary and craniopharyngiomas
  • Para magnetic substances like gadolinium.

All the first 3 structures are white on T1

choices.text: Anode is made of molybdenum in mammography and of tungsten in X-ray tubes
The is made filter of molybdenum in mammography and aluminium in X-ray tubes
The radiation dose is more in chest radiography as compared to mammography
Exit window made of beryllium in mammography and of glass in an X-ray tube

questions.text: Which of the following is false about mammography and conventional X-rays tubes?
questions.solution: In chest x-ray the radiation dose is 0.02 msv whereas in mammography the radiation dose is 0.5-0.7msv which is higher compared to chest x-ray

choices.text: Filters help in reducing the radiation dose as they filter out low-energy Xray
GRIDs are kept in Infront of the patient, and they prevent scatter radiation
X-ray films are made of silver bromide and silver halide
Collimation helps in directing X-ray beams

questions.text: Which of the following statement is not true about modern X-ray acquisition?
questions.solution: Grids are parallel lead lines and they are placed behind patient and in front of film, they prevent scatter radiation from forming the image.

questions.text: A 35-year-old lady, G3P2L2 (7 weeks POG), comes to an emergency with chief complaints of right upper quadrant pain and yellow discolouration of the skin, Emergency sonography revealed mild to moderate bi-lobar intrahepatic biliary dilation, but the exact cause could not be identified. In order to find out the underlying cause, which of the following diagnostic imaging modality will give the best diagnostic yield and will be safe?
questions.solution: Percutaneous cholangiography, ERCP and barium meal follow through all are Xray based procedures. MRCP is non ionising radiation and is safe to use in intra hepatic biliary dilatation.

questions.text: Which of the following is correctly matched regarding radiation units;
questions.solution: Important radiation units to remember :

choices.text: Deterministic side effects are dose- dependent
Stochastic side effects have a linear relationship with the absorbed dose and probability of effect
Acute radiation syndromes are a type of stochastic side effect

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about radiation side effects:
questions.solution:
Examples of stochastic effects are- mutations, cancers. they are linear and have no threshold

Examples of deterministic effects are- skin erythema, cataracts, somatic GI syndromes, metabolic syndromes. They are non linear and have threshold dose.

questions.text: What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
There is molar tooth sign which is seen in Joubert syndrome

  • Vermis becomes hypoplastic and cerebellar peduncles elongate this gives batwing 4th ventricle.
  • Agenesis of corpus callosum leads to racing car sign
  • Dandy walker malformation leads to large post fossa cyst
  • Arnold chiari malformation leads to banana sign or lemon sign on antenatal scan

questions.text: A 35 years old female known case of Hiv, with CD4<300, presents with fever, dyspnea, cough, and xray has been taken shows Causative Organism is
questions.solution:
The radiograph shows multiple millet like opacities suggestive of military tb

Military mottling is seen in

  • Sarcoidosis
  • Histoplasmosis
  • Pulmonary hemosiderosis (mitral stenosis)

questions.text: A 22 year old female with primary infertility underwent HSG examination and shown below, what is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: The radiograph shows two leech wilkinson's cannula showing two endometrial cavities opening into two different uterus.
